Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell- or calyx-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of upper part of maenad wearing a chiton and himation, looking to right and holding thrysos; relief-contour except for outline of clothes.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 497, no. C37)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0223) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 45, pl. L, no. 14)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
